Central AC and Heating Repair Services You Can TrustWhen your home comfort is on the line, Sears Home Services delivers fast, professional central AC and heating repair. Our certified HVAC technicians diagnose and fix problems with air conditioners, furnaces, and heat pumps—restoring comfort in no time.
We service all major brands, including Carrier, Trane, Lennox, Goodman, and more. Whether your AC isn’t cooling, your heater won’t start, or your thermostat is unresponsive, we’ve got you covered.
HVAC Services Offered:

Diagnosis and repair of common issues (e.g., not cooling, leaking, unusual noises)
Replacement of faulty components (e.g., compressors, thermostats, capacitors)
Routine HVAC maintenance services

Why Choose Sears Home Services for Your Central AC Repair Service?
For generations, homeowners across America have trusted Sears for reliable home services. Our legacy of excellence continues today with our professional cooling system repair service that stands out above the competition:


Experienced Technicians: Our nationwide network of trained professionals undergoes rigorous certification and regular training to stay current with the latest AC technologies and repair techniques.


Comprehensive Service: From initial diagnosis to complete repair, we handle every aspect of getting your air conditioner back to peak performance.


Trusted Reputation: With decades of experience serving American homeowners, Sears Home Services brings unmatched expertise and reliability to every service call.


Satisfaction Guaranteed: We stand behind our work with industry-leading guarantees that give you peace of mind with every repair.


Nationwide Coverage: When you’re looking for “air conditioner repair service near me,” you’ll typically find that we have service available in your local area.


Ready to schedule your service? Book your HVAC repair appointment online now or call our customer service representatives at 1-802-613-1926 to set up service.

full_content.content: Frequently Asked Questions About Central AC and Heating Repair ServiceHow much does AC and heating repair cost?Costs vary depending on the type of HVAC system and issue. Minor repairs start around $150, while complex furnace or AC repairs may range from $300–$1,200. Sears provides a full cost estimate before any work begins.Do you offer same-day HVAC repair?Yes. In many areas, Sears offers same-day AC and heating repair appointments. Availability may vary based on location and technician schedules.How can I schedule a repair appointment?You can schedule an appointment online through our website or by calling our customer service hotline.Do you guarantee your work?Yes. Sears Home Services guarantees all repair work. We are committed to resolving your appliance issues thoroughly and ensuring that our repairs provide a reliable, lasting solution. Our goal is to give you peace of mind, knowing that we stand behind our work and are dedicated to restoring your appliance to proper working order.

full_content.content:
Common Air Conditioning and Heating Issues We Repair
Our skilled technicians are equipped to handle a wide range of air conditioning repair issues, including:


Insufficient Cooling: When your AC runs but doesn't cool properly


Strange Noises: Banging, rattling, or whistling sounds during operation


System Short-Cycling: Units that turn on and off too frequently


Refrigerant Leaks: Reduced cooling power due to low refrigerant levels


Frozen Evaporator Coils: Ice buildup preventing proper cooling


Electrical Control Failures: Issues with starters, wiring, or control boards


Thermostat Malfunctions: Inaccurate temperature readings or control problems


Drainage Issues: Water leakage or improper condensate removal


Dirty Components: Clogged filters or coils reducing efficiency


Complete System Failures: Units that won't turn on or have stopped working entirely


Warning Signs Your Air Conditioner Needs Professional Attention
Don't wait until your AC stops working completely like the Johnson family did. Watch for these signs that indicate your system needs professional AC repair service:


Weak Airflow: When air coming from vents lacks force


Warm Air: System is running but not producing cool air


Frequent Cycling: Unit turns on and off more frequently than normal


Unusual Sounds: Grinding, scraping, or banging during operation


Strange Odors: Musty, burning, or unusual smells when system runs


High Humidity: Home feels unusually humid despite AC operation


Water Leaks: Moisture or active leaks around your indoor unit


Rising Energy Bills: Sudden increases in electricity usage


Inconsistent Temperatures: Some rooms are cooler than others


System Age: Units over 10 years old often need more frequent repairs



A Customer's Experience: The Johnson Family's AC Emergency
It was the hottest weekend of the year when the Johnsons' air conditioning system failed completely. With temperatures soaring into the 90s and humidity making it feel even worse, their two-story home quickly became unbearable, especially for their elderly mother who was visiting.
"I called Sears Home Services in a panic on Saturday morning, expecting we'd have to wait until Monday," recalls Sarah Johnson. "But within two hours, a technician named Miguel arrived, completely prepared and professional despite the emergency circumstances."
The diagnosis revealed a failed capacitor and worn contactor—relatively simple fixes that nevertheless would have left the family suffering through the entire weekend. Miguel had both parts on his service vehicle and completed the repair in just over an hour.
"What impressed me most wasn't just the quick service, but how thoroughly Miguel explained what had happened and showed me exactly what to watch for in the future," Sarah explains. "He even pointed out a developing issue with our condensate line that could have caused water damage if left unchecked, and fixed it on the spot at no extra charge."
Three summers later, the Johnson family's air conditioner continues to run flawlessly. "That emergency AC repair actually turned out to be a blessing in disguise," Sarah notes. "The maintenance tips Miguel provided have helped us avoid any further issues, and we now have Sears come out for preventative check-ups each spring. The peace of mind is worth every penny."

full_content.content: A Customer's Experience: The Johnson Family's AC Emergency
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: It was the hottest weekend of the year when the Johnsons' air conditioning system failed completely. With temperatures soaring into the 90s and humidity making it feel even worse, their two-story home quickly became unbearable, especially for their elderly mother who was visiting.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: "I called Sears Home Services in a panic on Saturday morning, expecting we'd have to wait until Monday," recalls Sarah Johnson. "But within two hours, a technician named Miguel arrived, completely prepared and professional despite the emergency circumstances."
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: The diagnosis revealed a failed capacitor and worn contactor—relatively simple fixes that nevertheless would have left the family suffering through the entire weekend. Miguel had both parts on his service vehicle and completed the repair in just over an hour.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: "What impressed me most wasn't just the quick service, but how thoroughly Miguel explained what had happened and showed me exactly what to watch for in the future," Sarah explains. "He even pointed out a developing issue with our condensate line that could have caused water damage if left unchecked, and fixed it on the spot at no extra charge."
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Three summers later, the Johnson family's air conditioner continues to run flawlessly. "That emergency AC repair actually turned out to be a blessing in disguise," Sarah notes. "The maintenance tips Miguel provided have helped us avoid any further issues, and we now have Sears come out for preventative check-ups each spring. The peace of mind is worth every penny."
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

Glossary TermsWhat is a 608 Certification?The 608 Certification, mandated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is required for HVAC technicians to legally handle refrigerants. It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.What is a Compressor?A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.What is a Condenser?A condenser is a component of HVAC and refrigeration systems, responsible for releasing absorbed heat from the refrigerant into the outside air or a water line, thus facilitating the cooling process.What is a Capacitor in an AC Unit?A capacitor in an AC unit is an electrical component that stores and releases electrical energy to help start the motor and stabilize the voltage during operation.
